subject: Politics
title: What Is Geopolitics
description: A quick, practical guide to What Is Geopolitics.

hook.text: Russia invaded Ukraine partly for a warm-water port. Geography still drives the fate of nations.

buildup.text: Geopolitics studies how geography â€” mountains, rivers, oceans, resources â€” shapes political power and conflict.

discovery.text: Halford Mackinder argued that whoever controls the Eurasian 'heartland' controls the world.

twist.text: Technology changes geopolitics but doesn't erase it. Missiles fly over mountains, but armies still can't.

climax.text: Every major conflict traces back to geography: borders, resources, trade routes, or strategic territory.

punchline.text: Maps explain more about politics than speeches ever will.

quiz.question: What does geopolitics primarily study?
options: How geography shapes political power and conflict
How elections work across different countries
The internal politics of individual nations
